title: Incredibly relaxing, and stress relieving!
text: My wife booked this as a treat for our 20th wedding anniversary, and I had no idea what to expect. I was absolutely blown away by the experience, and I will say that we will come to AIRE every time we visit Copenhagen. There are several different types of pools, all based on water temperature and experience, from a sauna, hot water pool, medium water temperature pool, absolutely cold temperature pool, a pool with jets, a pool with rocks on the bottom to walk through, absolutely refreshing and relaxing. To top it off, we had a 1 hour massage. This was an awesome 2.5 hours and one we will be repeating!

title: This place continues to impress!
text: We had been here a few times before the COVID shutdown and were excited to be able to come back when the government allowed restaurants to be opened again. We live just a few hours away by train, so this was the first place we wanted to go when it was allowed. Our waiter actually remembered us and even the things we ordered the last time we were there. I will say that the food here is some of the best food we've ever eaten, and we have had just about everything on the menu. The same level of service and quality of food is back from before and it's lovely. The cocktail menu is also outstanding. Please come here if you get the chance.

title: Peaceful in the heart of the city
text: We stayed in a superior deluxe room with a private balcony. It allowed us to enjoy the weather while relaxing privately. The room was clean, the shower was very nice with plenty of hot water. We enjoyed the sitting area with the couch and chair as well. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful with getting us taxis and answering questions. The hotel is very central to the Kobenhavn H train station as well. One item of note was the mattress on the bed was a bit soft and springy for our taste but otherwise the stay was great.

title: Enjoyable! Good service and food
text: We happened to be staying in the hotel and decided to give this restaurant a try, and we were not disappointed. The food and service were great. We started with a chef's choice of anitpasti, and for the main course my wife had a nice tagliatele with beef tenderloin, and I had the lasagna. To finish we shared a tiramisu. The wine selection was good as well, mainly focusing on the Italian wines. Our waiter was very attentive and came back to check on us often. Overall, a fine Italian option if you are in the area.

title: Excellent food, great service and wine pairings
text: My wife and I came for dinner and chose the 7 course set menu with wine pairings and it did not disappoint. The food is excellent, and the service was even better. We enjoyed each course, but the best for me was the main course (I chose the chicken, my wife chose the fish). The atmosphere was very cozy as well. We were not disappointed by any aspect of the meal, and will be back in the future.

title: Good variety at a good price, something for everyone
text: We come here often and it's hard to be disappointed. There are lots of options here for whatever you may want: Asian, Mexican, Danish, Italian, Turkish, Nepalese, French, etc. The price is not bad either, so if you are in the area, come and check it out.

title: Excellent burgers, great fries, and awesome service!
text: We have been here several times during the past year, and I figured it was about time I wrote a review. The burgers are excellent, made as you order, the fries are outstanding as well, but the service here is what brings me back. They do an excellent job. I would suggest trying the chili mayo with the fries, as it's the best I've ever tasted.

title: Nice place to stay, clean and very good staff
text: Stayed here last week for a business meeting and really enjoyed it. They have all the COVID preparations under control and it’s good to see. Try the rooftop bar for nice views of the ocean and surrounding areas. I enjoyed the shower as well (nice water pressure).

title: Wow! Very cool place to visit
text: Loved the whole experience. The castle was cool but the grounds were better (especially the mazes). The car exhibition was very nice too.

title: Excellent food. Menu and wine list very good
text: Excellent food. Menu and wine list are very good. Very nice atmosphere as well. You will need reservations on a weekend evening to get in. We had the confit de canard and it was lovely.

title: All You Can Eat Sushi for One Price
text: Excellent food and great service. One price, all the sushi you can eat. Order from an iPad at the table, and it will magically appear. Highly recommend this place in a great location close to the Koldinghus.

title: Ribeye is to die for!
text: Went to dinner here last week and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The ribeye steak was top-class. The tables were socially distanced, and they have changed from family sides to individual sides for the COVID era. If meat is your thing, you won't get a better experience than here.

title: Nice oasis in the forest!
text: I stayed here during a recent conference for my business, and enjoyed it. The staff is great, the place is clean and the setting is very nice and peaceful in a forested area. Masks are required in all common areas of course, and the restaurant is available for take away.

title: Not worth the hype, but if you want to see it, spend a few minutes to get some photos.
text: Dirty, overblown and full of hype. The signs/colors/tv screens and pure capitalistic intention is plain for all to see, and for that alone it is worth it to see, but I wouldn't recommend spending too much time here. It tends to be a target for tourists and ways to separate you from your money.

title: Eh, something to do if you're in the area
text: Nice for a photo opportunity. Be prepared for waiting. When we were there, NYPD were "guarding" the bull from protesters. It seems kind of overblown but I could see the curiosity behind it.

title: Great Views of Statue of Liberty
text: This is a nice place to visit for the views alone. If you are able to be here on a clear day, the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island are good photo opportunities. The memorials to the military are a nice touch as well. We were able to have a little pit stop at the restaurant on the water, so if you have time, it's worth it.

title: You have to see it when you are in NYC
text: We didn't have time to do other than walk outside and take a lot of pictures. We would have enjoyed the full experience, and will come back when COVID is over.

title: The Meat Palace!
text: We have been to several Fogo de Chao restaurants across the country, and this one is no different than the others. The food is excellent, the service outstanding. It was a very nice evening for dinner on the sidewalk. We were happy to have the opportunity to eat at a restaurant during the COVID times. The location is good, being just off Broadway as well.

title: Cute little green area in the middle of Manhattan, next to Library.
text: We stopped here for a little respite from walking and enjoyed ourselves looking around. The area itself is just next to the public library, and has lots of food/drink stands around it. It was worth a quick visit.

title: Oasis in the concrete jungle
text: We found this place very peaceful, and it was even possible to find little areas of solitude among this place of so many people. I recommend having a little picnic and enjoying the scenery. We also tried to take pictures of all the bridges for a blog post.

title: 9/11 Exhibit....A Must See!
text: What can you say here that hasn't already been said? This place is excellent, very tasteful and respectful for the events that happened here. We were very moved by the actual exhibits and the waterfalls, with the names of all the victims in marble along the edges.

title: Sushi was excellent, try the oxtail fried rice!
text: We booked this place because we stayed in the hotel. It was pleasantly surprising. The portion size was small for the price but not unexpected. I recommend having the oxtail fried rice along with sushi. Reservations are needed as it is a small restaurant. The service was also very good.

title: Good location, nice staff - next to Central Park
text: Loved this location, and the staff was excellent. It's main selling point is being by Central Park, and not too far away from Times Square and Broadway. Room amenities were good, not great. If you get a chance, try the sushi restaurant in the hotel, it is excellent.

title: Excellent service, Great Food in Horsens
text: My family and I stopped here for dinner last weekend and were pleasantly surprised by the place. The food was surprisingly good, but the service was outstanding, and the ambience of the place was great. If you are looking for a nice place to eat in Horsens and want a good menu with lots of options, look no further than Corfitz. We will definitely be back here in the future.

title: Really good fun for the whole family
text: Amazing place to visit with children of all ages (adults included). Bring rain boots and gear as it can be muddy. This has parts where you get out of the car and walk, and times when you have to drive through. There is a wide range of animals to view (camels, ostrich, flamingos, lions, wolves, goats, giraffes, monkeys) and more, with a children's petting area. There are multiple parking areas, picnic areas, playgrounds as well. Outside food and drink are allowed as well. There is also a safari bus if you don't want to drive your car around.

title: Awesome family fun!
text: Excellent time for all (family of 8) at this amusement park! Rides were great, fun for all. During this time of year they were only open on weekends, and there were no lines on the rides. Especially liked the social distancing and mask requirements for the bigger rides. We will buy season tickets next spring for sure! They also have a park map written in English.

title: Excellent seafood, sit in the courtyard if available
text: My family and I ate here last weekend and thoroughly enjoyed it. We had the omelette (with lobster and potatoes), lobster itself, mussels, fried oysters, and a nice wine pairing. The service was also excellent, so please try this place, it is really worth the trip.

title: Enjoyable day at Tivoli
text: I’ll be honest that I didn’t have high expectations before going here, but I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised at the park. The grounds are tastefully done and the rides are better than I thought they would be. The food selection is definitely better than you usually see at an amusement park as well. As with most of these places, the queues can be a bit long for the rides but they weren’t too bad on the day we went. Definitely worth a visit if in Copenhagen.

title: The Two Seas - Northernmost point of Denmark
text: Very Interesting and worth while to visit. Seeing the two seas physically come together is impressive. Be sure to check the weather before going and be prepared. It was windy and a little rainy during our time there. The currents don't really allow for swimming very well, and the water was cold anyway. The time spent there was very pleasant. You can take the transport there from the parking lot to the drop off point for a 20 DKK fee per person if you feel like walking, but that's part of the attraction. The kids enjoyed seeing the sea lions lounging on the beach as well.

title: Good Place, Great Location
text: We stopped here after a trip to Skagen and enjoyed the food. Good menu, fish and chips, shrimps, and soft serve ice cream. What else could you want? The restaurant sits in the marina, so the view is very nice and they offer outside seating, so if the weather permits, take advantage of it.

title: Nice, clean place to stay in Frederikshavn
text: We stayed here during our latest holiday trip to Northern Jutland. We were not expecting much, but what we found was pleasantly surprising. The place was clean, service was great and I recommend taking the time for the the complimentary breakfast as it is worth it. If you are staying on the side closest to the car lot, expect car wash noises late into the night if your windows are open.

title: Good food and service
text: My family and I came to eat dinner after a long day at Legoland, and really enjoyed the food and the service. We had a varied dish selection of pastas, and pizza and all were tasty. The wine selection is pretty solid as well. All in all, worth a visit if you are hungry in Billund.

title: Nice place to visit with younger children
text: Legoland is a nice experience, really set up well for young children. However, I'd say the maximum age this park is good for is around 12, as they base the attractions for the younger ages (probably rightfully so). The miniature cities and attractions of Europe are a nice touch. If you want to eat a sit down type of meal, be prepared to wait as they are not set up for long lines of people. Overall a pleasant place to visit, logistically set up well.

title: Beautiful and Impressive Castle and Grounds
text: Very cool palace, impressive in nature. The chapel with the Danish royal coats of arms was interesting. I enjoyed the detail displayed on the ceilings, and the woodwork. I particularly enjoyed the room displaying items and clothing from Queen Margarethe II. There are some remodeling/preservation works going on, which is to be expected while visiting European castles. If you are going castle visiting while in Denmark, put this one on your list.

title: Great Food and Atmosphere
text: We stayed in an apartment while in Copenhagen for the weekend and one of the recommendations for places to eat was here at the Union Kitchen. We decided to take a chance as it was on our way to a place we were sightseeing and we were not disappointed. We came back the next day as well, and in the end, we ordered just about everything on the breakfast menu and everything was fabulous, not to mention the wonderful cocktails and fantastic service. Please try this place!

title: Excellent place for a little French ambience in Denmark
text:
We stopped by here on a whim while visiting Horsens and were not disappointed. The outside seating provided a great place to sit and people watch, but the menu did not disappoint either. We had the tapas plate as a starter, which was outstanding. This was nicely paired with a bottle of French Rose, followed by our main course, which was good as well (omelette, burger, and salad). The service was outstanding as well.
Worth a visit if you get a chance to go. I recommend it highly.

title: Danish History....a must see!
text: Fantastic place to visit and it's free! The burial mounds are just just hills at this point, but the visitor center details the story of the excavation and how the burial chambers were engineered. The rune stones are exemplary, considering they are over 1,000 years old. The writing on the stones mark the first time that the word Denmark was used, and also the conversion to Christianity. Both new to me. The visitor's center has a fantastic interactive display that makes it a must see place. The Church marks the burial spot of Gorm the Old with a silver marker in the floor.
place: Jelling Mounds, Runic Stones and Church

title: Excellent Lunch!
text: We came here on a Sunday afternoon and thoroughly enjoyed the food and service. The pasta is homemade and the sauces are very good. My children had pizza and it was very good as well. We recommend going here if you want good Italian food, at a good price and a nice ambience.

title: The Old Town Square is extremely beautiful!
text: The first time we entered this square was breathtaking. The clock is cool, but the square is amazing with all the architecture and history. We were there for the Christmas markets in December and the mood was very festive and crowded but very cool. I would recommend this area very highly. This is must-see Prague at its best.
place: Old Town Hall with Astronomical Clock

title: Green fairy and cool ambience!
text: This place is nice! We enjoyed the ambience and historical aspect of this old bar. It definitely has it's motif and it's very popular. Stop by and enjoy at taste of the green fairy. They have a very large selection of absinthe and it's made in many different ways. Be careful and pace yourself or take someone trustworthy with you.

title: Wow! Beautiful is all I can say!
text: This church is a bit off the beaten path but I would have to put this on the list if visiting Prague. The Vysehrad area is a must-see area of Prague. I found this area to be a place of solitude and relaxation in a hectic and crowded city. The sightseeing around the area itself is very beautiful but the Basilica is spectacular.
place: Basilica of St Peter and St Paul

title: Taught me something about history
text: We visited this place when we were on a walking tour of Prague and the guide was very knowledgeable regarding the history of this place and St. Agnes herself. Worth a visit here if you have time and can go with someone who knows the history.
place: Convent of St Agnes of Bohemia - National Gallery Prague

title: Outstanding Historical Complex
text: Lots of interesting history here in this large complex. The walk to the area is uphill but worth it. Plan on spending a few hours here in the seat of government for the Czech Republic.

title: Mesmerizing!
text: We were traveling through the area looking for a place to stop and eat and stumbled across this interesting piece of art when we saw dozens of people staring at this fascinating piece. Definitely worth visiting if in Prague.

title: Wow! Very Impressive!
text: This is a must see when visiting Prague. Take your time and leisurely stroll along the bridge and just enjoy yourself. The statuary and architecture of this bridge not to mention the scenery along the river is just spectacular. Be careful about the crowds, as they are usually massive and pickpockets are plenty.

title: Loved this Museum, lots of variety!
text: I was really surprised by this museum. I didn't expect much but left impressed. The rocks/gem collection was excellent (geodes, moon rocks and Mars rocks were my favorite) but the room that was dedicated to the Apollo program was very cool. I would recommend going here if you have time.

title: Beautiful Cathedral
text: This place is worth the visit, definitely. It is simply beautiful. It is free to enter, but the tours cost money when inside. My kids did the catacombs tour and really enjoyed that and the history lesson the guide gave. They also climbed one of the towers and saw an amazing view of the city. Don't get caught up in the length of the lines and tourists around and inside the church as it is packed, but worth it.

title: Oldest town in Denmark
text: We went expecting Vikings but it was more than that. This is also about the history of Denmark’s oldest town. There are some pretty cool artifacts and interactive exhibits to see. The highlight is the hedgehog necklace so check it out. The rune exhibit was fun and allowed you to spell things out in tunes and take pictures. Good fun on a cold December day.

title: Surprising little place in a nice atmosphere
text: My family and I were looking for a place to eat that could seat 8 as we were in town for the Christmas Market. This place was a good place to find. The menu was very good, and has an English printed one as well, if you ask. We had the schnitzel, which was very good. The wine list was not large but had good options (Riesling and Spanish red is what we chose). The service was very good as well, so overall a pleasant experience.

title: Nice Location, average food.
text: We stayed across the street, and ate at Cafe Razz. The atmosphere is excellent as the location is great (by the water). This place is usually always busy, especially when the weather is nice. The food itself is regular pub food if you would describe it. The staff and service are not very good, so take that into account. The location and liveliness of the area is what draws you to this place.

title: Nice little getaway in Middelfart
text: My family and I stayed here for a month in July and really enjoyed it. The big french windows with a view of the water was outstanding and very relaxing. The area around the hotel is lively due to the Cafe Razz across the street. There is no staff on duty, all is done via envelopes, key cards and e-mail. We found the owner to be very nice and accommodating to all our needs. There is a private garage available for use at an extra fee as well. I would recommend this place highly.

title: Castle and Grounds - Nice!
text: This was an unexpected little slice of the country in Copenhagen. I enjoyed this visit more than the Amalienborg Palace as the gardens attached to this castle are very nice indeed. The public seems to agree as there were a lot more visitors to this castle than Amalienborg (short walk away).

title: Nice Ceremony - Love the Danish flavor
text: Having seen this at other locations throughout Europe, it was nice to get a Danish view of this, and it did not disappoint. Please stop by and see this if you are in Copenhagen. It's very accessible, and the crowds are not massive as they are in London.
place: Changing of her Majesty's guard at Amalienborg Castle

title: Hotel itself not so bad....location and atmosphere not so good
text: We thought this would be ok to stay a for a few hours before catching a bus trip back to Denmark. The location is not the best (close to the train station/bus station), but its ok. The nature of the hotel itself tends to lend itself to a younger crowd, and not conducive to a good night's rest. The noise outside on the street is such that you cannot open a window, so bring earplugs to block the noise. The building that we stayed in is not close to the building where you check in, so be advised of that. I would not recommend if you are a traveling family. If you are young and single and more used to the hostel lifestyle then maybe this place is for you.

title: Cave of Zeus....long walk uphill, so be prepared
text: This was a must see place for my 17 year old, so we lined it up. The walk up to the cave itself is quite a hike uphill, so be prepared and bring water. Once in the cave, it is a haul to get down to the bottom and back up, so take it at your own pace. Overall, not sure what connects this cave to Zeus, but it was a good experience and nice to get some exercise in nature.

title: Nice steakhouse in Crete
text: Pretty good steakhouse by European standards. We were looking for a little taste of home after our European travels, so this suited us well. Stay with the tried and true cuts of beef and you'll be ok. The atmosphere was excellent, with nice sea views, and breeze off the water. Overall an enjoyable evening.

title: Love this place!
text: We stayed at a hotel close by for 3 nights and went to eat here twice during our stay. The service, hospitality, and food are excellent. I highly recommend going here to eat and enjoy the view as well. This is what I think of when I think of a nice, family-oriented Greek restaurant.

title: How old is this place?
text: The shear age of this place is fascinating....thinking about how long ago this place was built and inhabited is incredible. This may be the oldest civilization in Europe if estimates are correct. The self-paced tour was our choice so we got to walk around at our own leisure. I would highly recommend going to this place if you have time on Crete.

title: Great location and price
text: We stayed here for a weekend in Copenhagen and would recommend it. The reason we chose it is its central location and great price. The rooms are 4 bunk beds and can be rented by the bed instead of the room, so take this into account if you want something private. Towels are extra if you don't bring your own.

title: Very affordable, great view and beach access
text: My family and I staying here on vacation in October of this year and thoroughly enjoyed it. We had a great view of the beach and a nice balcony to enjoy a glass of wine with. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and readily available downstairs at the jewelry shop. The area around the hotel is nice as well, with plenty of food, nightlife and shopping. We will be back here in the future.
